channel.title: Running Windows 7/XP on server?
channel.description:
So (some may already know) I've got a server. With Windows Server 08 on it. Right? Cool. So I can't bot on that server (yes, RSBot) without having VIP (Fu[b][/b]ck paying.). I'd assume this is because it's picking up the bios and it says it's a server, not computer.
So if I throw windows 7/XP/8 on there, it [i]should[/i] read as a normal computer, and I'll be golden.
But my question is, are there any significant downsides to not running server OS on a server?
Or.. I mean. If anyone knows how to spoof the OS to be windows XP/7. That'd be cool.

item.title: Running Windows 7/XP on server?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:520758”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=639269.msg4309161#msg4309161 date=1370463699]
It will likely run on proprietary drivers, what kind of driver problems are you expecting? CPU would be fine, HDD, RAM, would all be fine, only ones you’ll need to worry about are GPU and network cards, even then the GPU is likely supported as it’ll be integrated(?), and if it’s a wired ethernet connection there shouldn’t be a problem.
[/quote]
For once in my life, I can say Dell Support actually was quick and reliable on getting the right answers (idk if the guy was actually with dell, but it was their forums).
I had to install RAID drivers during the install, but after that it was golden. I’m told some features won’t work. Like Hot Swapping and such. But this is only temp.
-Topic can be closed.[/quote]watch your mouth! o.o did you just say Dell did a good job? Ruby get the thermometer…

Read full topic

item.title: Running Windows 7/XP on server?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

SilentCJ:

It will likely run on proprietary drivers, what kind of driver problems are you expecting? CPU would be fine, HDD, RAM, would all be fine, only ones you’ll need to worry about are GPU and network cards, even then the GPU is likely supported as it’ll be integrated(?), and if it’s a wired ethernet connection there shouldn’t be a problem.

For once in my life, I can say Dell Support actually was quick and reliable on getting the right answers (idk if the guy was actually with dell, but it was their forums).
I had to install RAID drivers during the install, but after that it was golden. I’m told some features won’t work. Like Hot Swapping and such. But this is only temp.
-Topic can be closed.

Read full topic

@SilentCJ wrote:

It will likely run on proprietary drivers, what kind of driver problems are you expecting? CPU would be fine, HDD, RAM, would all be fine, only ones you’ll need to worry about are GPU and network cards, even then the GPU is likely supported as it’ll be integrated(?), and if it’s a wired ethernet connection there shouldn’t be a problem.

item.title: Running Windows 7/XP on server?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:13, topic:520758”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=639269.msg4309014#msg4309014 date=1370435762]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=639269.msg4309011#msg4309011 date=1370435437]

I am going to assume you’re asking this question because the bot you use checks to see if it’s running under a server OS, in that case then yes you might as well just change the OS.

Yeah but you have to get the correct drivers and such for the install, which idk what ones nor where they could be.
[/quote]I doubt you will find a straight answer on mopar about the drivers needed quite honestly…depending on what actual server you own I would suggest referring to that server support site.

So I get to deal with Dell?
great…
[/quote]yeah that sounds about right sorry babe. :([/quote]
throws server at car on the highway
^Still better than dealing with Dell tech support.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Windows 7/XP on server?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Loveandpower:

I guess you COULD use windows 7 if you had a windows server 08. From a quick google search it appears that several drivers for windows 7 could be exchanged for the server drivers so it’s very possible I assume.

I just don’t feel like paying $8/Month to use my own damn server.

Read full topic
